name: pygls-playground
description: Extension for experimenting with pygls powered language servers
author: Open Law Library

pygls.server.cwd.description: The working directory from which to launch the server.
pygls.server.cwd.markdownDescription:
The working directory from which to launch the server.
If blank, this will default to the `examples/servers` directory.

pygls.server.debug.description: Enable debugging of the server process.

pygls.server.debugHost.description: The host on which the server process to debug is running.

pygls.server.debugPort.description: The port number on which the server process to debug is listening.

pygls.server.launchScript.description: The python script to run when launching the server.
pygls.server.launchScript.markdownDescription:
The python script to run when launching the server.
 Relative to #pygls.server.cwd#

pygls.server.pythonCommand.description:
The command to use when launching the python interpreter used to run the server.
By default, this extension will attempt to use the Python interpreter configured via the Python extension, setting this setting will override this behavior.

pygls.trace.server.description: Controls if LSP messages send to/from the server should be logged.
enumDescriptions: do not log any lsp messages
log all lsp messages sent to/from the server
log all lsp messages sent to/from the server, including their contents

pygls.client.documentSelector.description: The client uses this to decide which documents the server is able to help with.
pygls.client.documentSelector.markdownDescription:
The client uses this to decide which documents the server is able to help with.
 See [DocumentSelector](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#documentFilter) in the LSP Specification for more details.
